section.title: Restricting network access
section.p: This section provides basic guidance on setting up a firewall around your Eucalyptus components. It is not intended to be exhaustive.
On the CLC, you should allow the following connections:

ul.li: Inbound from end-users on TCP ports 8773 and 8443
Inbound from CC and Eucalyptus instances (public IPs) on port 8773 (for metadata service)
Inbound from Walrus, SC, and VB on TCP port 8777
Inbound from Walrus, SC, and VB over TCP
Inbound from Walrus, SC, and VB on UDP port 7500
Multicast from CLC, SC, and VB to IP 228.7.7.3 on UDP port 8773
Inbound and outbound to DNS ports

section.p: On the CC, you should ensure that all firewall rules are compatible with the dynamic changes performed by Eucalyptus, described in the section below. You should also allow the following connections:

ul.li: Inbound from CLC on TCP port 8774
Inbound from NC on port TCP 8776, if CC image proxying is enabled

section.p: On Walrus, you should allow the following connections:

ul.li: Inbound from end-users on TCP port 8773
Inbound from SC, NC, and VB on TCP port 8773
Inbound from CC on port TCP 8773, if CC image proxying is enabled
Inbound from CLC, SC, and VB over TCP
Inbound from CLC, SC, and VB on UDP port 7500
Multicast from CLC, SC, and VB to IP 228.7.7.3 on UDP port 8773

section.p: On the SC, you should allow the following connections:

ul.li: Inbound from CLC, NC, and VB on TCP port 8773
Inbound from CLC, Walrus, and VB over TCP
Inbound from CLC, Walrus, and VB on UDP port 7500
Multicast from CLC, Walrus, and VB to IP 228.7.7.3 on UDP port 8773
Inbound from NC on TCP port 3260, if tgt (iSCSI open source target) is used for EBS storage

section.p: On the NC, you should allow the following connections:

ul.li: Inbound from CC on TCP port 8775
Inbound from other NCs on port 16514
DHCP traffic forwarding to VMs
Traffic forwarding to and from instances' private IP addresses

section.p: On the VMware Broker, you should allow the following connections:

ul.li: Inbound from CC on TCP port 8773
Inbound from CLC, Walrus, and SC over TCP
Inbound from CLC, Walrus, and SC on UDP port 7500
Multicast from CLC, Walrus, and SC to IP 228.7.7.3 on UDP port 8773

section.title: Managing iptables rules for the CC
section.p: In Managed and Managed (No VLAN) modes, Eucalyptus flushes the CC's iptables rules for both filter and nat, then it sets the default policy for the FORWARD chain in filter to DROP. At run time, the CC adds and removes rules from FORWARD as users add and remove ingress rules from their active security groups. In addition, the nat table is configured to allow VMs access to the external network using IP masquerading, and dynamically adds/removes rules in the nat table as users assign and unassign public IPs to VMs at instance boot or run-time.
